DataElement.preferredName: Left Arm Antecubital Fossa Circumference Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the circumference measurement at the left arm antecubital fossa.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Left Arm Antecubital Fossa Circumference Measurement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the wrist and located on the left side of the body.:A triangular space on the anterior side of the elbow joint. Three main veins of the arm, the brachial artery, the medial nerve and the tendon of the biceps pass through this space._The length of the closed curve of a circle; the size of something as given by the distance around it._Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the wrist and located on the left side of the body.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the wrist and located on the left side of the body.

Property.preferredDefinition: A triangular space on the anterior side of the elbow joint. Concepts.definition: A triangular space on the anterior side of the elbow joint. Three main veins of the arm, the brachial artery, the medial nerve and the tendon of the biceps pass through this space.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb._Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
